program.title: Program: Financial Therapy
program.subtitle: Define your priorities. Organize your money. Move forward with clarity.
program.intro: Financial Therapy is a 1:1 program where we work together so you can make financial decisions with purpose, based on your personal priorities. The goal is simple: recognize your current financial well-being, set realistic goals, and build a plan that helps you move forward without relying on generic formulas or outside recommendations disconnected from your reality.

q1.title: What is Financial Therapy?
q1.body: It‚Äôs a practical process of education and guidance that helps organize your personal finances, reduce financial stress, and support clear decision-making. It‚Äôs not about austerity‚Äîit‚Äôs about using money as a tool to reach your life goals.

q2.title: How is it different from traditional financial advising?
q2.body: I don‚Äôt sell a product tied to the problem. The approach is independent and educational: I provide clarity with tools, simulators, and a plan you can apply to your reality, without conflicts of interest.

q3.title: What can I expect from a 1:1 session?
q3.body: In each session we review your current financial situation, define your goals, and work with simulators or practical exercises (loans, investments, budgets). You leave with concrete steps and support materials.

q4.title: Do I need prior financial knowledge?
q4.body: No. The idea is to start from zero if needed. The concepts are explained simply and applied to your daily life.

q5.title: How long are the sessions and how are they held?
q5.body: Each session lasts about 45 minutes and is held online, so you can connect from anywhere.

q6.title: Do the simulators replace advising?
q6.body: No. Simulators are support tools to visualize scenarios. Advising adds interpretation, strategy, and a personalized plan for you.

q7.title: What if I already have debt?
q7.body: We can work on a plan to organize and pay it down, evaluating alternatives to reduce financial costs and prevent the debt cycle from growing.

q8.title: Does the advising include investments?
q8.body: Yes, we review investment options based on your profile and goals, always in a general and educational way. I don‚Äôt provide specific buy or sell recommendations; I teach you how to compare and decide with criteria.

q9.title: How do I schedule a session?
q9.body: You can do it directly from the Schedule section on this page. There you choose the day and time.

q10.title: Who can take these sessions?
q10.body: Anyone who wants to improve their relationship with money, learn to manage loans, organize personal finances, or start investing with confidence.
